comments.body:
Is there a license file we can include from the source using `license_file`?

Also can add `license_family: LGPL`.

@jakirkham I have a question. As I browsed through the source code, this package contains 3 different licenses: GPL 2.0, GPL 3.0 and LGPL 3.0.
What should be done in this case?
- The license file for GPL 2 is: COPYING-GPLV2
- The license file for GPL 3 is: COPYING
- The license file for LGPL 3 is: COPYING-LGPLV3

From what I see, most of the code is LGPL V3 or GPL V2.
- [libelf](https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/elfutils.git/tree/libelf/elf.h): LGPL 3
- [libebl](https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/elfutils.git/tree/libebl/ebl-hooks.h): LGPL 3 or GPL 2
- [libdwfl](https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/elfutils.git/tree/libdwfl/libdwfl.h): LGPL 3 or GPL 2
- [libdwelf](https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/elfutils.git/tree/libdwelf/libdwelf.h): LGPL 3 or GPL 2
- [libdw](https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/elfutils.git/tree/libdw/dwarf.h): LGPL 3 or GPL 2
- [libcpu](https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/elfutils.git/tree/libcpu/i386_data.h): LGPL 3 or GPL 2
- [libasm](https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/elfutils.git/tree/libasm/libasm.h): LGPL 3 or GPL 2

I couldn't find any sources saying that it uses GPL 3.

Good question. Unfortunately, we still have sorted that out. IMHO would just include the LGPL-3 license file.

xref: https://github.com/conda/conda-build/issues/1247
